# 1.Lab: Unit Testing

This document defines the lab exercises for [&quot;C# OOP Advanced&quot; course @ Software University](https://softuni.bg/trainings/2085/csharp-oop-advanced-november-2018).

# 2.Part I: Unit Testing Basics

1. 1.Test Axe

Load the provided solution in Visual Studio. Add a new project - **Tests**

Create a class **AxeTests**

Create the following tests:

- Test if weapon loses durability after each attack
- Test attacking with a broken weapon

### Solution

 ![](data:image/*;base64,)

1. 2.Test Dummy

Create a class **DummyTests**

Create the following tests:

- Dummy loses health if attacked
- Dead Dummy throws an exception if attacked
- Dead Dummy can give XP
- Alive Dummy can&#39;t give XP

### Hints

Follow the logic of the previous problem

1. 3.Refactor Tests

Refactor the tests for **Axe** and **Dummy** classes

Make sure that:

- **Names** of test methods are **descriptive**
- You use **appropriate**** assertions** (assert equals vs assert true)
- You use **assertion**** messages**
- There are **no magic numbers**
- There is **no code duplication** (Don&#39;t Repeat Yourself)

### Hints

Extract constants and private fields for the **Axe** class

Create a method that executes **before each test**

Make use of constants and private fields, as well as add assertion messages

Follow the same logic for the other test methods and the **TestDummy** class

# 3.Part II: Dependencies

1. 4.Fake Axe and Dummy

Test if a hero gains XP when the target dies

To do this, you need to:

- Make the **Hero** class **testable** (use **Dependency Injection** )
- Introduce **Interfaces** for Axe and Dummy
  - Interface Weapon
  - Interface Target

Create a fake Weapon and a fake Dummy for the test

### Hints

Create **I**** Weapon and ITarget **interface. Modify implementation methods to** make use of the interfaces. **Modify both** Axe **and** Dummy** classes.

Create **HeroTests** class and test gaining XP functionality by faking Weapon and Target classes

1. 5.Mocking

Include **Moq** in the project dependencies, then:

- Mock fakes from previous problem Hints

Go to **HeroTests** and refactor the code, making use of **Moq**
